github.jcext

Class Enqueuer<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • github.jcext.Enqueuer<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - type of queue items
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    NettyChannelWritesEnqueuer, TaskEnqueuer

    public abstract class Enqueuer<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    Enqueuer implements multiple-producer single-consumer pattern, anyone can offer message to the Enqueuer, but only the single consumer pollAsync(Queue) can read (poll) the queue.

    All operations in this class are non-blocking, so it doesn't need a separate thread.

    From the user point of view Enqueuer has only one method: offer(Object), this method is thread-safe.

    Descendants of this class must implement pollAsync(Queue) method.

    If you prefer lambdas instead of subclassing see Poller#newEnqueuer(Poller, Conf)

    Only offer() and isEmpty() methods of the Queue interface are used inside this class.

    See Also:
    Poller#newEnqueuer(Poller, Conf)

    • Method Detail

      • offer

        public final boolean offer(T t)
        This method just calls Queue.offer(Object), and possibly schedules pollAsync(Queue) execution.
        Returns:
        what Queue.offer(Object) returns, false means queue overflow for bounded queues.

        See Also:
        Queue.offer(Object)

      • pollAsync

        protected abstract java.util.concurrent.CompletionStage<?> pollAsync(java.util.Queue<T> queue)
        This method will be scheduled for execution, only if the queue is not empty. It means that at least one queue.poll() must return non-null.

        This method will NOT be called, UNTIL the resultant CompletionStage of the previous call is completed. This property ensures that concurrent (parallel) calls of this method are impossible. And also that calls respect happens before relation, so you can freely mutate a shared state inside this method without extra locking.

        This method must be non-blocking.

        It may return null, which is interpreted the same as CompletableFuture.completedFuture(Object) (immediate completion)

        Never save the reference to the queue parameter anywhere, use it only inside the async computation of this method. i.e. you should not keep/use the queue after the resultant CompletionStage is completed

        You are free to call other methods of the queue in addition to poll().

      • associatedId

        public final java.lang.Object associatedId()
        User associated id, can be anything having good toString() method.
        See Also:
